text: John Hume Burges (26 October 1928 – 14 January 2015) was an Irish rugby union player who played in the scrum-half position. He was educated at St John's School, Leatherhead and was capped twice for Ireland.The Quest Goes On, Being a Short History of the First Hundred Years of St John's School, Leatherhead, by E.M.P. Williams. Published Leatherhead, 1951, p.50 ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Ireland international rugby union players Category:People educated at St John's School, Leatherhead
title: John Burgess (rugby union)
